result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Timothy C Ridgeman

records.addlTxt: Preliminary hearing on November 7, 2022 at 08:15 am.

1:05 PM Defendant Timothy C Ridgeman in court.  Attorney Noah Buhle for attorney Kevin Michael Gaertner in court for Timothy C Ridgeman. District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Julian Marrufo.  Preliminary Hearing requested. Preliminary time limits waived.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for November 7, 2022 at 08:15 am.
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection.
records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Wisconsin Community Service compliance letter received and filed. The defendant reported and will be monitored for 90 days.

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing. Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol. Defendant is not to enter any premises, other than a grocery store, that sells/serves alcohol beverages by the drink or into any liquor store.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant is not to use/possess any drug paraphernalia.  Defendant is not to operate a motor vehicle unless properly licensed.  Comply with all licensing restrictions. The defendant is ordered to comply with CAM monitoring through WCS.  CAM duration pursuant to Pretrial Supervision Program protocols. Defendant to pay costs associated with CAM.   The Defendant to report to WCS within one (1) business day of being released. Defendant to have no contact with victim A (EXCEPTION: 3rd party contact for the sole purpose of an insurance claim) listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.  Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney.

2:30 PM District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Niki Kane. Defendant Timothy C Ridgeman in court, in custody.  Attorney Ricardo Tapia in court for Timothy C Ridgeman. Attorney appears as friend of the court. 

Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint. 
Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties. 
Court advises of right to an attorney. Defendant is not eligible for State Public Defender representation. Defendant to seek counsel. 
Court tolled time limits for preliminary hearing.
Hearing scheduled for October 7, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
To Seal Victim/Witness Identification Key, Signed by Judge Jennifer R. Dorow on September 29th, 2022.
Waukesha County Public Safety Assessment Report filed by Wisconsin Community Services.
Victim/Witness Identification Key filed, under seal, by the District Attorney's office.
